Comment: Hi everyone!  At Leslie's request, I am annotating an unrated game in which Les has been playing with his mentor, Etienne.  Etienne, who is in my group, is also being mentored by David Patron.  Anyhow, the opening starts off with wild and woolly opening.  Unfortunately for Les it does not work out, but I am sure we will all learn from what happened after the pseudo-sacrifice on f7.  We start off with a double king pawn opening which is 1. e4 e5.
3. ...... Nf6 - the two knights defense.  This will transpose into the Three Knights Opening on the next turn.
3. ...... Nf6 - the two knights defense.  This will transpose into the Three Knights Opening on the next turn.
3. ...... Nf6 - the two knights defense.  This will transpose into the Three Knights Opening on the next turn.
3. ...... Nf6 - the two knights defense.  This will transpose into the Three Knights Opening on the next turn.
3. ...... Nf6 - the two knights defense.  This will transpose into the Three Knights Opening on the next turn.
5. ...... Kxf7 - Etienne accepts the sacrifice.  However, Les can actually recover the loss by playing Nxe4 on the next turn.
5. ...... Kxf7 - Etienne accepts the sacrifice.  However, Les can actually recover the loss by playing Nxe4 on the next turn.
5. ...... Kxf7 - Etienne accepts the sacrifice.  However, Les can actually recover the loss by playing Nxe4 on the next turn.

7. Neg5+ - Les goes for Etienne's exposed king.  Unfortunately for him, there are not enough pieces developed to put King Etienne into Old Matey's shadow.
7. Neg5+ - Les goes for Etienne's exposed king.  Unfortunately for him, there are not enough pieces developed to put King Etienne into Old Matey's shadow.
7. Neg5+ - Les goes for Etienne's exposed king.  Unfortunately for him, there are not enough pieces developed to put King Etienne into Old Matey's shadow.
7. ...... Kg8 - sanctuary.  It does however, block in the KR.  Can Les cash in on this?  We shall see.
9. Nh3 - forced retreat.
9. Nh3 - forced retreat.
9. Nh3 - forced retreat.
10. Qd2 - risks BxN busting up white's kingside.  However, because King Les (WK) is still in the centre, maybe an open g file will be beneficial to white because King Etienne (BK) is right on it!
11. Nhg1 - now Les must prevent the trade off to avoid losing a pawn to Qxf3.
11. Nhg1 - now Les must prevent the trade off to avoid losing a pawn to Qxf3.
12. h3 - trying to drive off the lsb.
12. h3 - trying to drive off the lsb.
13. ..... Re8 - placing a black rook on the same file as King Les and his better half.  Les must watch out for a possible pin down the e column.
13. ..... Re8 - placing a black rook on the same file as King Les and his better half.  Les must watch out for a possible pin down the e column.
13. ..... Re8 - placing a black rook on the same file as King Les and his better half.  Les must watch out for a possible pin down the e column.
14. Kd1 - evades pin but now white cannot castle.
16. Be3 - development but it puts white's dsb into a pin and leaves the b2 pawn en prise to the BQ.
16. Be3 - development but it puts white's dsb into a pin and leaves the b2 pawn en prise to the BQ.

17. ..... Ba3 - eschews taking the pawn on a2.  If the white dsb ever moves off the c1-h6 diagonal or gets taken then King Les will cop Old Matey instantly.
17. ..... Ba3 - eschews taking the pawn on a2.  If the white dsb ever moves off the c1-h6 diagonal or gets taken then King Les will cop Old Matey instantly.

18. ..... Kh7 - clears a space for the black KR to come to an open file.
18. ..... Kh7 - clears a space for the black KR to come to an open file.
19. Ne2 - a deck clearing move.
19. ..... Nb4 - threatening Nxa2 which gangs up on the hapless rook on c1.
21. fxe3 - an exchange sac on Etienne's part, but the fireworks haven't ended.

23. ...... Nxa2+ - the point.  After this plethora of blood letting, Etienne ends up two pawns to the good.
